entry.title: Melee Major Wins
entry.content:
Melee Tournament Wins by Player

Click here to see the interactive version

I'm a big fan of Super Smash Brothers Melee and have played it basically since it came out. I've entered a few tournaments and learned that despite all these years I am not good at the game. At the highest level of play very few players excel. Even after 15 years of competition, less than 20 players have won a major tournament. This data can be found on Liquipedia

Stacked Area charts show how different values change over time. Its basically a bunch of multi line chart but the series are stacked on top of each other. This leads to some unique quirks. First, its easy to tell the summed value of all the series. However it isn't feasible to determine the value of an individual series.

I decided to create a stacked area chart using each player that has won a major tournament as a series. It definitely pushed the limit of how many unique, meaningful colors I could put into the chart. I thought about reducing the group by only considering players who have won more than one tournament. However, its such an accomplishment that I did not want to leave anyone out. There were some interesting takeaways from seeing this data in a visual format. First is how some players had droughts lasting years in between wins. Second was seeing when each player left a mark on the game's history.
entry.summary: Stacked area chart depicting Melee tournament wins

entry.title: Attitudes Towards Turbines
entry.content:
Attitudes Towards Wind Energy by Distance to Nearest Turbine

Click here to see the interactive version

Pictograms utilize icons to convey information. Each icon represents an equal value of data. They add more personality to the visualization and can be easier to understand. D3 has limited built in elements but custom svg art can be used. SVG icons are widely available online on websites like IcoMoon.

This pictogram is an alternate take on the survey results found in Berkeley Lab's National Survey of Attitudes of Wind Power Project Neighbors. The report contains five bargraphs that depict the spread of people's attitude towards wind projects based on the distance of their home to the nearest wind turbine. Unsurpisingly, residents are less content the closer they live to a wind energy project.

Utilizing interaction effects, this information can be conveyed in a single, updating chart. All five survey distance results are included in the HTML file. At first the overall results are displayed. When the mouse is placed near text, the data will be changed to the corresponding survey results and the visualization is updated. This effect was achieved by placing invisible rectangles over the text that contain the mouseover interaction instructions.
entry.summary: Survey results of feelings about wind energy

entry.title: Matthew Chapter 20
entry.content: 1 “സ്വർഗ്ഗരാജ്യം തന്റെ മുന്തിരിത്തോട്ടത്തിൽ വേലക്കാരെ വിളിച്ചാക്കേണ്ടതിന്നു പുലർച്ചെക്കു പുറപ്പെട്ട വീട്ടുടയവനോടു സദൃശം. 1 Svarggaraajyam thante munthirittheaattatthil velakkaare vilicchaakkendathinnu pularcchekku purappetta veettutayavaneaatu sadrusham. 2 വേലക്കാരോടു അവൻ ദിവസത്തേക്കു ഓരോ വെള്ളിക്കാശു പറഞ്ഞൊത്തിട്ടു, അവരെ മുന്തിരിത്തോട്ടത്തിൽ അയച്ചു. 2 Velakkaareaatu അവൻ divasatthekku oreaa vellikkaashu paranjotthittu, avare munthirittheaattatthil ayacchu. 3 മൂന്നാം മണിനേരത്തും പുറപ്പെട്ടു, മറ്റു ചിലർ ചന്തയിൽ മിനക്കെട്ടു നില്ക്കുന്നതു കണ്ടു: 3 Moonnaam manineratthum purappettu, mattu chilar chanthayil minakkettu nilkkunnathu കണ്ടു: 4 നിങ്ങളും മുന്തിരിത്തോട്ടത്തിൽ പോകുവിൻ; ന്യായമായതു തരാം എന്നു അവരോടു പറഞ്ഞു; അവർ പോയി. 4 ningalum munthirittheaattatthil peaakuvin; nyaayamaayathu tharaam ennu avareaatu paranju; അവർ പോയി. 5 അവൻ ആറാം മണിനേരത്തും ഒമ്പതാം മണി നേരത്തും ചെന്നു അങ്ങനെ തന്നേ ചെയ്തു. 5 അവൻ aaraam manineratthum ompathaam mani neratthum chennu angane thanne cheythu. 6 പതിനൊന്നാം മണി നേരത്തും ചെന്നു, മറ്റു ചിലർ നില്ക്കുന്നതു കണ്ടിട്ടു; നിങ്ങൾ ഇവിടെ പകൽ മുഴുവൻ മിനക്കെട്ടു നില്ക്കുന്നതു എന്തു എന്നു ചോദിച്ചു. 6 Pathinonnaam mani neratthum chennu, mattu chilar nilkkunnathu kandittu; നിങ്ങൾ ivite pakal muzhuvan minakkettu nilkkunnathu enthu ennu cheaadicchu. 7 ഞങ്ങളെ ആരും കൂലിക്കു വിളിക്കായ്കകൊണ്ടത്രേ എന്നു അവർ പറഞ്ഞപ്പോൾ: നിങ്ങളും മുന്തിരിത്തോട്ടത്തിലേക്കു ചെല്ലുവിൻ എന്നു അവരോടു പറഞ്ഞു. 7 ഞങ്ങളെ aarum koolikku vilikkaaykakondathre ennu അവർ paranjappeaal: ningalum munthirittheaattatthilekku chelluvin ennu avareaatu paranju. 8 സന്ധ്യയായപ്പോൾ മുന്തിരിത്തോട്ടത്തിന്റെ ഉടയവൻ തന്റെ വിചാരകനോടു: വേലക്കാരെ വിളിച്ചു, പിമ്പന്മാർ തുടങ്ങി മുമ്പന്മാർവരെ അവർക്കു കൂലി കൊടുക്ക എന്നു പറഞ്ഞു. 8 Sandhyayaayappeaal munthirittheaattatthinte utayavan thante vichaarakaneaatu: velakkaare vilicchu, pimpanmaar thutangi mumpanmaarvare avarkku kooli kotukka ennu പറഞ്ഞു. 9 അങ്ങനെ പതിനൊന്നാം മണിനേരത്തു വന്നവർ ചെന്നു ഓരോ വെള്ളിക്കാശു വാങ്ങി. 9 Angane pathinonnaam manineratthu vannavar chennu oreaa vellikkaashu vaangi. 10 മുമ്പന്മാർ വന്നപ്പോൾ തങ്ങൾക്കു അധികം കിട്ടും എന്നു നിരൂപിച്ചു; അവർക്കും ഓരോ വെള്ളിക്കാശു കിട്ടി. 10 Mumpanmaar vannappeaal thangalkku adhikam kittum ennu niroopicchu; avarkkum oreaa vellikkaashu കിട്ടി. 11 അതു വാങ്ങീട്ടു അവർ വീട്ടുടയവന്റെ നേരെ പിറുപിറുത്തു: 11 Athu vaangeettu അവർ veettutayavante nere pirupirutthu: 12 ഈ പിമ്പന്മാർ ഒരു മണിനേരം മാത്രം വേല ചെയ്തിട്ടും നീ അവരെ പകലത്തെ ഭാരവും വെയിലും സഹിച്ച ഞങ്ങളോടു സമമാക്കിയല്ലോ എന്നു പറഞ്ഞു. 12 ee pimpanmaar oru manineram maathram vela cheythittum നീ avare pakalatthe bhaaravum veyilum sahiccha njangaleaatu samamaakkiyallo ennu paranju. 13 അവരിൽ ഒരുത്തനോടു അവൻ ഉത്തരം പറഞ്ഞതു: സ്നേഹിതാ, ഞാൻ നിന്നോടു അന്യായം ചെയ്യുന്നില്ല; നീ എന്നോടു ഒരു പണം പറഞ്ഞൊത്തില്ലയോ? 13 Avaril orutthaneaatu avan uttharam paranjathu: snehithaa, ഞാൻ ninneaatu anyaayam cheyyunnilla; നീ enneaatu oru panam paranjotthillayeaa? 14 നിന്റേതു വാങ്ങി പൊയ്ക്കൊൾക; നിനക്കു തന്നതുപോലെ ഈ പിമ്പന്നും കൊടുപ്പാൻ എനിക്കു മനസ്സു. 14 Nintethu vaangi poykkolka; ninakku thannathupeaale ee pimpannum kotuppaan enikku manasu. 15 എനിക്കുള്ളതിനെക്കൊണ്ടു മനസ്സുപോലെ ചെയ്‍വാൻ എനിക്കു ന്യായമില്ലയോ? ഞാൻ നല്ലവൻ ആകകൊണ്ടു നിന്റെ കണ്ണു കടിക്കുന്നുവോ? 15 Enikkullathinekkondu manasupeaale cheyvaan enikku nyaayamillayeaa? ഞാൻ nallavan aakakondu ninte kannu katikkunnuveaa? 16 ഇങ്ങനെ പിമ്പന്മാർ മുമ്പൻ മാരും മുമ്പന്മാർ പിമ്പന്മാരും ആകും.” 16 Ingane pimpanmaar mumpan maarum mumpanmaar pimpanmaarum ആകും.

entry.title: Turbine Production/Efficiency
entry.content:
United States Wind Energy Production

Click here to see the interactive version

Line charts are a tried and true method of visualizing data that has been around for centuries. It is best suited for showing how a dependent variable changes over time. The most basic line chart requires a path that intersects with all of the data points. The data points themselves can also be marked with an icon which helps readability. When using D3 the path is only one element. Marking the datapoints can provide more mouseover interaction opportunities and increased data density.

This visualization combines data from two sources. Counts from the United States Wind Turbine Database and energy production from WINDExchange . The line plots the total wind energy produced each year. The circles are colored to create groupings based on production per wind turbine. Additionally, Mousing over a circle reveals a tooltip that shows the average turbine production.

The progression of circle colors shows that turbines are becoming more efficient. This is important since land is a commodity. Hopefully there will be more breakthroughs in turbine efficiency that push the average even higher.

entry.title: Rice & Roti
entry.content:
Rice & Roti

Click here to see the interactive version

Carb choice is serious business in India. I colored in this map to understand which states eat rice and which eat roti. The results were not too surprising, basically the north west are the biggest consumers of wheat. There were a few neutral states in the center. Most of the states ate a combination, even if it was unbalanced. States in the north west were very polarized. This may caused by their physical and cultural connection to other Asian countries.
entry.summary: Comparison of rice and roti consumption by state

entry.title: Windenergy
entry.content:
Wind Energy

Wind Energy in the United States

The first electricity generating wind turbine in America was built by Charles Brush in 1888. It stood in Ohio at 60 feet table and was capable of generating 12kW of electricity.

Fast forward 92 years and the world's first wind farm was constructed in Crotched Mountain, New Hampshire. Built in 1992, the wind farm consisted of 20 wind turbines with a capacity of 30 kilowatts each.

Now there are over 50,000 wind turbines in the United States that can produce 90,000 megawatts in a year. This represents around 5% of the energy production in the country.

And tomorrow? WINDExchange believes the United States could produce 10,640,080MW.

Locations of Wind Turbines in the United States

The United States Geologic Survey has released a dataset containing the location of every turbine in the country. Plotting this information reveals what regions are best suited for producing wind energy.

This visualization shows us that a handful of regions contain the majority of wind turbines. Wind speeds must reach 6 miles per hour before electrical energy is produced. This makes the Great Plains ideal wind energy producers.

This can be further shown by plotting each state's output individually. Source: WINDExchange

Although it takes some years for Texas to take the lead, the state becomes the country's largest wind energy producer by a large margin. Additionally, many states do not meet the conditions to be high wind energy producers.

Wind Energy Production by State


For us to reach WINDExchange's goal of 10 million MegaWatts per year we have to multiply our current wind output by 10 times. This would mean having hundreds of thousands more turbines.

Overall, there is a trend of increasing turbine efficiency but it isn't large enough. There must be a breakthrough in turbine efficiency that brings the number of turbines required to a reasonable amount.

Total Production and Turbine Efficiency

One of the benefits of wind energy is that once the turbine is installed, the energy it produces is free. But nothing is truly free. One concern is the feelings of residents who live near turbines. Source: Berkeley Lab's National Survey of Attitudes of Wind Power Project Neighbors

For the most part, people do not have issues with living over a mile away from a turbine. However there is noticible discontent among residents who are within half a mile. As more turbines are built, and the trend towards larger turbines continues, this will became problematic for more people.

Attitudes Towards Wind Projects by Distance

WINDExchange's potential estimate of 10 million MegaWatts seems lofty. Without major improvements to turbine efficiency, there probably isn't even enough space to fit the necessary turbines.

Still, a lot of progress has been made since the first wind farms. We should be proud of the advances that allow for the level of production that exists today.
entry.summary: Wind Energy .line { fill: none; stroke: black; stroke-width: 2px; }

entry.title: The Bias-Variance Tradeoff
entry.content:
What is Bias?

Bias is how much the model predictions are off compared to the actual values. If the bias is low, the prediction was accurate. If the bias is high, the prediction was inaccurate.

What is Variance?

Variance is the spread of the predictions. If the variance is low, the model is making predictions that are close to each other. If the variance is high, the model is making predictions that are far apart.

The Tradeoff

The goal is to get a low bias and a low variance. That means the model is making accurate, consistent predictions. The bias can be decreased by increasing the variance. That means the model will predict more accurately if it is given more flexibility but that can be erratic. Variance can be decreased by incresing the bias. That means the model can predict more consistent values but they will be less accurate.

Application

This concept gives insight on overfitting. A high variance may not initially seem like an issue, after all, the model is predicting accurate values. However, this makes the model overly attached to the training data. Its important to minimize both the bias and variance.
entry.summary: A balancing act for making predictions
